content.raw:
I found that the `record_one_run.bash` script did not end for me. I was recording a video of a SubT log file that had two robots, X2a and X2b. I see the following output:

```
[Dbg] [LogVideoRecorder.cc:401] Following entity: X2a
[Dbg] [LogVideoRecorder.cc:423] Recording video tmp_video_recording.mp4
[Dbg] [LogVideoRecorder.cc:384] Play log 

...

end of log file reached 
end time 3715
[Dbg] [LogVideoRecorder.cc:427] Stopping video recorder
[Dbg] [LogVideoRecorder.cc:375] Rewind Playback 
[Dbg] [SimulationRunner.cc:208] Rewinding simulation back to time zero.
[Dbg] [LogVideoRecorder.cc:401] Following entity: X2b
[Dbg] [LogVideoRecorder.cc:423] Recording video tmp_video_recording.mp4
[Dbg] [LogVideoRecorder.cc:384] Play log 
end of log file reached 
end time 3715
[Dbg] [LogVideoRecorder.cc:427] Stopping video recorder

[Dbg] [LogVideoRecorder.cc:375] Rewind Playback 
[Dbg] [SimulationRunner.cc:208] Rewinding simulation back to time zero.
[Dbg] [LogVideoRecorder.cc:333] Finish Recording
```

Gazebo keeps running after the "Finish Recording" message. The output of `ign topic -e -t /log_video_recorder/status` is: `data: "end"`.
